snippet: The topics of the seven books reviewed here range widely, so readers may find something of interest, for themselves or as a Father’s Day gift.
abstract: Dana Jennings reviews book How to Be a Good Motorist, edited by the Bodleian Library; Joseph Siano reviews book Hard Luck Lloyd: The Complete Story of Slow-Talking, Fast-Driving Texan Lloyd Ruby by John Lingle; Lindsay Brooke reviews books The Bonneville Salt Flats: Two Decades of Photography by Peter Vincent and Bonneville: A Century of Speed by David Fetherston and Ron Main; Richard S Chang reviews book McLaren From the Inside: Photographs by Tyler Alexander; Aaron Betsky reviews book Automotive Jewelry: Volume One: Mascots and Badges by Michael Furman; Leo Levine reviews book Cord Complete: The Story of the Models 810 and 812 by Josh B Malks.

byline.original: By CHARLES McEWEN, DANA JENNINGS, JOSEPH SIANO, LINDSAY BROOKE, RICHARD S. CHANG, AARON BETSKY and LEO LEVINE

lead_paragraph: The topics of the seven books reviewed here range widely, so readers may find something of interest, for themselves or as a Father’s Day gift.

headline.print_headline: In Print and Bound for the Road
headline.main: In Print and Bound for the Road
